data.title: Cool new functions for camera: fade,flash,shake
data.body:
usage : 

a color for your fade,a position for fade,how fast the fade should apply
fade(Color(255,255,255),Vector2(-200,-150),.3)

a color for your flash,a position for flash,how fast the flash should apply
flash(Color(255,255,255),Vector2(-200,-150),.3)

data.title: _draw function called only once!?
data.body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7363306/5606840/928c6894-944b-11e4-9835-238b5dd44c6f.png)

Why this function is called only once!?

data.title: Fix issue #1113
Compiling under OS X 10.10 fails
data.body:
Hi,

I freshly forked Godot at commit f39473ae7adf11e16b2a7aae2f84764a3225752b, cloned and tried to compile via
scons platform=osx

scons is installed via Brew and has the version 2.3.4, OS X is at 10.10.

This is the error I get:

g++ -o bin/godot.osx.tools.32 -arch i386 -framework Cocoa -framework OpenGL -framework AGL -framework AudioUnit -lz platform/osx/os_osx.osx.tools.32.o platform/osx/godot_main_osx.osx.tools.32.o platform/osx/audio_driver_osx.osx.tools.32.o platform/osx/sem_osx.osx.tools.32.o main/libmain.osx.tools.32.a modules/libmodules.osx.tools.32.a bin/tests/libtests.osx.tools.32.a drivers/libdrivers.osx.tools.32.a drivers/libdrivers0.osx.tools.32.a drivers/libdrivers1.osx.tools.32.a drivers/libdrivers2.osx.tools.32.a drivers/libdrivers3.osx.tools.32.a tools/libtool.osx.tools.32.a tools/freetype/libfreetype_builtin2.osx.tools.32.a tools/freetype/libfreetype_builtin1.osx.tools.32.a scene/libscene.osx.tools.32.a servers/libservers.osx.tools.32.a core/libcore.osx.tools.32.a -lpthread
Undefined symbols for architecture i386:

data.title: Submenu size in animation editor
data.body:
There is a small UI issue on the Call Func Track keyframe editor. It doesn't scale well when you have 2 arguments. It seems that the threshold of the scroll bar it's missed by some pixels.

![godotissue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2244403/5606234/2b1cf54e-9404-11e4-96a4-92de4d15b4b7.PNG)

It's only a little detail but the greatest things are made of little details :)

data.title: Issue with OS X default meta key and code completion
data.body:
The default meta key on OS X is Cmd. The shortcut for triggering the code completion is meta + space.
But Cmd + space is an OS X shortcut to bring up spotlight.

(I know you are not using OS X, just for completeness and maybe I'll be able to fix it myself)

data.title: Can't derive constants from other constants in inner classes
data.body:
``` python
# Test.gd
const FOO = 0
const BAR = 1
const DICT = {
    FOO: 0,
    BAR: 0
}
# this constant dictionary is ok

class Test:
    const TEST_FOO = 0
    const TEST_BAR = 1
    const TEST_DICT = {
        TEST_FOO: 0,
        TEST_BAR: 0
    }
# constant dictionary in subclass was throw an error.
# error: Expected constant expression
```

data.title: Debugger Points To Incorrect Code Line in Base GDScript File
data.body:
Really verbose title, but it's not too difficult to understand. Basically, you have a "base" file and you require an instance of a class from an external file. If that class references a variable that doesn't exist, the debugger will point to the error in the line number of the class, but in the "base" GDScript file. The error will be: `invalid set index 'keycode' (on base: 'Reference ()").` 

Here are the example script files:

The base .gd file:

```
extends Spatial

var other = preload("res://external/input.gd")

func _ready():

    var input_key = other.InputKey.new(other.IT_KEY, "A")
```

And the "input.gd" file.

```
const IT_KEY = 0

class InputKey:

    var input_type
    #var keycode  # What's necessary to make it work

    func _init(input_type, keycode):

        self.input_type = input_type
        self.keycode = keycode
```

data.title: SurfaceTool tangent generation
data.body:
Import - 3D Mesh 

turning on generate tangent, normal or smooth shading causes seams at the uv seams.
Work around is to turn off options for tangent, normal, or smooth shading when importing an obj.

data.title: Small additions to GDScript // var++ and switch()
data.body:
# ++ and -- operators

Being able to do:

```
var a
a++
a--
```

instead of

```
a+=1
a-=1
```
# switch

also, a switch() would be good as well.. as in

```
func a(param):
    switch(param):
      case "a":
         break
      case "b"
          ...
```
# $(NodePath) function

alias of get_node(NodePath)

It looks like jQuery so it's more fun and familiar to Javascript programmers

I think there is a $"NodePath" but it looks kinda weird to me :P

data.title: Issues with non english keyboards in the editor
data.body:
I'm using a german keyboard and for undoing something, I have to hit Meta+Y instead of Meta-Z.
Y is on the german keyboard where Z is on the english one.

Also, I can't type [ and ]. They are here on alt+5 and alt+6

Operating System: OS X 10.10

data.title: Update camera_2d.h
New shake function
data.body:
This function is used for shaking the screen.Usage :  camera.shake(rand_range(-2,2.3),rand_range(-1,1)) 

Also I`d love to add the possibility to fade and flash the screen but I cant find anything related to color in camera_2d.cpp.Any help please?

data.title: Changed texturebutton scale from float to Size2
Add camera dolly and improve camera pan (feature request #1084)
data.body:
The camera dolly moves the camera in the direction perpendicular to the screen, if it gets too close to the camera pivot, the pivot its dragged too.

The camera pan is changed to work like in maya, i.e. it grabs the scene by the 3d point that results from the mouse cursor being projected onto the plane parallel to the screen that contains the camera pivot.

The camera zoom moves the pivot if we get too close, just like maya does. If the mouse wheel or the zoom-by-draging come to close to de camera pivot, the camera zoom becomes heavy/slow, and we can't zoom anymore, what maya does is that it pushes the pivot by something like 10 units in front of the camera, if we insist trying to zoom in more.

data.title: Plugin extensibility without having to recompile the engine
data.body: I don't know if this is even possible with the infrastructure of Godot but I think it could be a great addition. For example, integrating third-party plugins for ads and IAP without having to modify and rebuild the engine would ease the learning curve a lot. Plus, it would probably accelerate plugin development by community members who aren't skilled with C++ (such as me).

data.title: Keyboard shortcuts for high-frequency actions
data.body: New Scene, Project Settings, and Editor Settings do not have keyboard shortcuts. They would be appreciated!

data.title: Godot window positions aren't being remembered
data.body:
I'm on Windows 7.

All Godot windows always start at the top left (0,0) of my monitor. This includes the Project List, the Main Editor, and the game when it's built and run using Godot. It doesn't remember that I move the windows around, nor does it remember that I maximize the Editor every time.

Not having to worry about this every time I launch the Editor or build games would be great.

data.title: Inspector selection behavior consistency
data.body:
Right now, if I click on a value in the Inspector, it first highlights that value but doesn't enter into edit mode for that value: http://puu.sh/e005z/19407efbe3.png

I have to click it again in order to start editing it: http://puu.sh/e007D/2d3e328b52.png

For other field types, such as dropdown selections and multi-field selections, it immediately starts editing with one click: http://puu.sh/e00cb/897c2d2830.png

To make it consistent, I think ONE click should immediately start editing no matter what.
#### 

Along the same lines, once you've finished editing a value and you click somewhere else, the value doesn't deselect: http://puu.sh/e00lz/262abd34b2.png

I think it would feel better if finishing with editing a value would deselect the value that was being edited.

data.title: Section highlighting in Scene Editor
data.body:
I like that the mouse-scroll is contextual to which section the mouse is currently hovering over (whether it's the Node list, the Inspector, the Scene View, etc). However, I think it would be more intuitive if the currently-hovered section was highlighted on hover.

For example, right now, if you click in the Inspector section of the editor, the whole Inspector section gets highlighted. If you move your mouse to hover over the Node list, the mouse-scroll affects the Node list but the Inspector stays highlighted. This is unintuitive. Instead, once the mouse hovers over the Node list, the Node list should be highlighted.

data.title: CTRL+A doesn't "highlight all" when typing in a text field
data.body: For example, if I'm creating a new script for a current node, a dialog pops up where I need to type out various path names and such. If I make a mistake, I typically use CTRL+A to highlight all of the text so I can start over. In Godot, however, the CTRL+A shortcut doesn't have any kind of text-highlighting functionality. Instead, it's bound to "Add New Node" and causes the new node dialog to show up.

data.title: CTRL+TAB should cycle tabs in Script Editor
data.body: Pretty much what the title says. If a custom keyboard shortcut can be set, even better!

data.title: Custom editor font doesn't save between sessions
data.body: I can't really reproduce this bug on demand but it has happened to me at least 5 times since I started playing around with custom editor fonts two days ago. Basically, I set the font for the script editor and it looks fine. I exit out. After a while, I boot up Godot again and the font is back to Source Code Pro even though the settings still show that my custom font is set.

data.title: Error messages when importing the export templates
data.body:
On importing the export templates, you get this error message:

  Can't open export templates zip

This happens on trying to import the freshly downloaded export_templates.tpz into Godot 1.0. Renaming the file extension to .zip is a workaround.

data.title: Fix for bug 1088
Fix for error 1088
Crashed in parse_json.
data.body:
When the json string is empty, it will crash.
A test code.

```
var h = {}
h.parse_json("")  # crash
h.parse_json(" ")  # go fine
```

data.title: change parameter name from ip to port
data.body: connect (host, port) not connect (host, ip)
